author: iheart.com
title: Toledo vs. Bowling Green Predictions - January 24 | iHeart Sports
text:
Photo: Getty Images
MAC play features the Toledo Rockets (10-8, 4-2 MAC) on the road against the Bowling Green Falcons (7-11, 2-4 MAC) on Friday, January 24, 2025 at 6:00 PM ET.
The Rockets are currently slight 1.5-point favorites against the Falcons. The over/under is 159.5 points for the matchup.

Toledo vs. Bowling Green Odds and Game Info Game day: Friday, January 24, 2025 Game time: 6:00 PM ET TV channel: CBS Sports Network Location: Bowling Green, Ohio Arena: Stroh Center Live stream: Watch this game on Paramount+ (Regional restrictions may apply) Catch men's college basketball action all year long on Fubo.
Toledo vs. Bowling Green Odds and Prediction Spread favorite: Toledo (-1.5) Moneyline: Toledo (-120), Bowling Green (+100) Total: 159.5 points Pick ATS: Bowling Green (+1.5)
Pick OU: Under (159.5) Prediction: Toledo 77, Bowling Green 76 Get tickets for any men's college basketball game this season at StubHub.
Toledo vs. Bowling Green Comparison Toledo Rank Toledo Stat Bowling Green Stat Bowling Green Rank 106th 77.5 Points Scored 76.6 135th 321st 77.8 Points Allowed 75.2 281st 209th 13.4 Assists 11.5 325th 19th 9.4 Turnovers 11.5 190th 108th 46.3% Field Goal % 44.7% 193rd 339th 47.3% Field Goal % Allowed 45.0% 269th Toledo Key Players The Rockets leader in points and assists is Sonny Wilson, who puts up 15.2 points per game along with 3.3 assists. Javan Simmons leads Toledo in rebounding, grabbing 5.7 rebounds per game while also scoring 12.6 points a contest. Sam Lewis leads the Rockets in three-point shooting, making an average of 1.4 shots per game from beyond the arc. Isaiah Adams is a standout on the defensive end for Toledo, leading the team in steals with 1.1 per game and blocks with 0.7 per contest. Bowling Green Key Players Marcus Johnson is at the top of the Falcons scoring leaderboard with 16.4 points per game. Johnson also pulls down 4.8 rebounds and racks up 1.8 assists per game. The Bowling Green leaders in rebounding and assists are Jamai Felt with 5.9 rebounds per game (also adding 5.3 points and 0.3 assists per game) and Javontae Campbell with 2.7 assists per game (also tacking on 13.9 points and 4.2 rebounds per game). Johnson is dependable from three-point range and leads the Falcons with 2.4 made threes per game. Campbell (3.2 steals per game) is the steal leader for Bowling Green while Felt (1.4 blocks per game) is the block leader.
